meanings.definition: Those who make something dirty or impure.
meanings.sent1: The befoulers left trash all over the park.
meanings.sent2: The befoulers of the river were careless polluters.
meanings.sent3: The befoulers of the kitchen were messy cooks.
meanings.sent4: The befoulers of the environment harm nature.
meanings.sent5: The befoulers of the playground were unruly children.

meanings.definition: To make something dirty or impure.
meanings.sent1: Please do not befoulers the clean water with mud.
meanings.sent2: The factory's waste befoulers the air we breathe.
meanings.sent3: Accidentally befoulers the mirror with fingerprints.
meanings.sent4: His lies befoulers the truth like a stain.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti befoulers the pristine walls of the building.
